body_html:
Thanks for the update!
…
On Fri, Mar 2, 2018 at 8:45 AM, Jonathan Raiman ***@***.***> wrote: Just wanted to post an update on #9091 <#9091> (cpu growth unbounded with feed dicts). - the error is not due to graph not being fixed - it is not caused by usingtf.zeros vs. tf.fill - I'm using cudnnLstm, not dynamic_rnn, so while_loops are also not the cause After updating to Tensorflow 1.6, the CPU growth dropped from the original 640mb/hr down to 25mb/hr (at most, not sure what the curve looks like). [e.g process starts out with 13.2gb of RAM, and 8 hours later is at 13.4gb of RAM] I now consider this issue fixed to the best of my knowledge! — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#13221 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim0o0cEhRyTiil28W2YCVCNuU93z2ks5taXcPgaJpZM4Pf_kL> .
body_text:
Thanks for the update!
…
On Fri, Mar 2, 2018 at 8:45 AM, Jonathan Raiman ***@***.***> wrote:
 Just wanted to post an update on #9091
 <#9091> (cpu growth
 unbounded with feed dicts).

    - the error is not due to graph not being fixed
    - it is not caused by usingtf.zeros vs. tf.fill
    - I'm using cudnnLstm, not dynamic_rnn, so while_loops are also not
    the cause

 After updating to Tensorflow 1.6, the CPU growth dropped from the original
 640mb/hr down to 25mb/hr (at most, not sure what the curve looks like).
 [e.g process starts out with 13.2gb of RAM, and 8 hours later is at 13.4gb
 of RAM]

 I now consider this issue fixed to the best of my knowledge!

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#13221 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim0o0cEhRyTiil28W2YCVCNuU93z2ks5taXcPgaJpZM4Pf_kL>
 .
body:
Thanks for the update!

On Fri, Mar 2, 2018 at 8:45 AM, Jonathan Raiman <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Just wanted to post an update on #9091
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/9091> (cpu growth
> unbounded with feed dicts).
>
>    - the error is not due to graph not being fixed
>    - it is not caused by usingtf.zeros vs. tf.fill
>    - I'm using cudnnLstm, not dynamic_rnn, so while_loops are also not
>    the cause
>
> After updating to Tensorflow 1.6, the CPU growth dropped from the original
> 640mb/hr down to 25mb/hr (at most, not sure what the curve looks like).
> [e.g process starts out with 13.2gb of RAM, and 8 hours later is at 13.4gb
> of RAM]
>
> I now consider this issue fixed to the best of my knowledge!
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub

> or mute the thread

> .
